description: I wish that the email pane had a max size, and give the rest of the area to the email preview.
super but need a manual refresh button so that if stuck it can be refreshed manually whe waiting for an important mail
It opens and then closes straight away.
opens to a log then closes right away
This is by far the best email client for GNOME. Works with my Gmail, and Outlook accounts, and has a simple UI.

It's beyond simple and lackluster. There is "active development" but I don't know what features are being integrated. It's missing just about you can imagine except for compose mail and a send button.
summary: Utter Trash. Not worth the time..

description: Complicated to delete accounts
I tried Evolution and Thunderbird. Geary looks much cleaner to me. Features I'd like to have - show all unread and manually pull from server. Overall - very good product
mail client to be integrated to gnome online accounts and truly follow modern GTK conventions.
This client has wonderful performance, syncs new mails and alerts over them while closed every time precisely, fine UI, snappy. No complaints.
summary: My absolute go to mail client

description: Excellent folder visualization and sync

I think most people these days will prefer simplicity over the very many options of classic email clients. That said, Geary sometimes acts quirky with accounts, and has issues like an inability to show forwarded messages. It would benefit from spam filtering, too, although I realize that would jeopardize the overall simplicity... but there are many libraries.
Minimalist, and just works! I use it through flatpaks
perfect mail client
If you get a lot of email, Geary is not for you. It's way too basic. But if you don't get much mail like me, it's perfect. It's clean, beautiful, efficient, and just works. Highly recommended :^)
summary: Great for people with basic email needs

description: Geary wouldnt connect to my Gmail accounts. Apparently, on the forums, if I lower Gmail to use less secure apps then it will work but I wasn't prepared to do this.

Much more focused than for example Evolution which felt bloated to me. Does its job, highly recommended. Also, to use it with Gmail, if you have 2FA enabled you have to generate an app password and use it to login instead. Cheers!
Works great!, its simply working.
https://wiki.gnome.org/Apps/Geary/FAQ

Firstly google did not trust this app as a secure client and blocked the authentication requests. outlook login worked fine though. Then the UI had no way to configure anything once initial setup was done . Think a app without a settings or preferences menu - thats Geary!

Gmail, and all are great! It supports accounts from Gnome Online Accounts (the settings app), however, in the latest 0.13 release, using Outlook accounts gives a SESSION_INAUTH error. Hope it can be fixed :D
summary: Great (review updated) but a few more regressions

description: Simple setup for a works IMAP account.
The UI is neatly integrated into GNOME. But it lacks many features such as PGP. Evolution remains the only usable mail client, for now.
summary: Great looks, lacks functionality of mail

description: No extra fluff, works well with Outlook.com 2FA (some security settings need adjusted online first though to allow the application to connect properly). Been using with no issues on Ubuntu 18.04, 18.10 and pre-release 19.04.
Evolution is working perfectly fine. I enter my Gmail details and it complains that either the username or password is invalid. That is all it does.

Same issue as others keeps saying smtp username or password is incorrect
Installed Evolution instead, and this works fine... So an issue with the software
I had to generate an "app password" in my Google account's security settings and it worked perfectly. Love this app!
The best Email application available on any Linux distribution, period. Simple, fast and so easy to use. The developers of Thunderbird and Evolution should be taking notes.
summary: Should be Ubuntu's default Email App

description: I wasn't able to login to my Yahoo mail but apart from that It works great with Gmail and Hotmail.
summary: Simple interfact, mostly similar to Mail of OS X

description: very easy using
i like the ui, very neat and clean.
Works great with Fastmail. Those having issues with Gmail should Google "Gmail and Geary" - and read specifically about the "less secure apps" silliness.
Cannot create gmail account, says username or password is invalid
Sometimes the app can't login on google because of the privacy settings. but the app works perfectly.
Always when I start geary ask me for the password, and it appears it doesnt work
summary: I doesnt save the gmail application password

description: Very basic. You need to allow 'older app access' option for your email provider in order for it to work. Limited options to configure the look.
Works fine on lInux Mint Gnome
summary: Email without giving permission to google account

description: Unable to validate.
Sends email two or three times
summary: Sends email two or three times

description: It's lightweight, works and looks great.
Cant connect not sure why.
kinda had to know most email clients lately are lacking proper developments, it will not take in the proper login details says they are incorrect when in fact i get notified i'm trying to log in.

Your regular Google password, if you're using 2FA, will not work. This is arguably a deficiency of Geary whereas both Thunderbird and Evolution support authenticating with Google directly, so I'm taking off a star for that. Otherwise, the app works fine.
summary: You need to create an app password on your Google account to use Gmail

description: It only allows accounts based on imap email, not pop --- totally worthless application

Google blocks "not trusted" applications (I suppose that means applications which aren't theirs? Not sure) - that's why when you log in a Gmail account from the app it will say "wrong password or username". If you want to fix this you can check your email from somewhere else and follow the instructions Google sent you.

I am giving the app 4 stars mainly because you can do less stuff with it than when you log in your email online (example being that you can't block/stop automated conversations... or maybe you can but I didn't find it). I am also not that big of a fan of email apps since you can always just hop online... although I got to say the app is really well made, simple to use and lightweight. It should do the job for someone who uses email applications.

Contrary to what the other review refers. Works fine. you just have to have a password generated by Google because Gmail uses authentication that the program doesn't have.
But it does work. Works fine, it's lightweight, does the job a email client should do. Takes few machine resources which is awesome in a world of bloated software that we live in.
so, it works and does what it claims in a very good way
Thank you developers of this great piece of software.
I don't know why
summary: Does not pick up Gnome online accounts

description: This e-mail client is far better than evolution and other e-mail clients I've tried out. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because search functionality is limited to "downloaded" messages only. It is not capable to search for messages on the e-mail server as far as I can see.
As previous reviewer after installation it does not get past adding email address and password, declaring both invalid

Any email that chooses to that places a higher value on looking slick that working in a fashion that's efficient and easy to understand is one you should avoid. You can't sort email by date or turn off conversations (conversations are a horrible way to organize email, you can always see whats said in the quoted text). This app isn't worth your time.
summary: Chooses looking cool over functioning logically and properly

description: My Gmail account won't work on this app, but outlook works.
gmail validation error
Gmail - login or password incorrect
summary: You cannot log in to your gmail account

description: It is not possible to set imap root folder, so imap folders different than inbox are inside inbox folder...
I think it deserves 5 starts, because it is the only mail client that shows badges on icon. Yeei! This was the only feature I wanted from ubuntu free mail client.
I tried to setup my Gmail and Riseup.net emails and it just complained about wrong credentials. Went back to Thunderbird.
As someone who likes a consistent UI, it's nice to see an app working together with the GNOME interface, fitting like a puzzle piece.

This is all on Debian Buster with GNOME 3.30.

Right off the bat, this program did not play nice with my mail server's security, so I had to tell the program to not use any security when logging in. After adding the mail account, I went to try to edit it and fiddle with it more to get the security to work, and I wasn't allowed to edit anything but the nickname and the password. It doesn't have features for PGP, it doesn't integrate with my contacts. This is the extent of my experience with the program, and after this I think I'll be sticking with Evolution a little while longer.

I will say that it does look better than Evolution, the UI is simpler and integrates better with GNOME. But that's pretty much all it has going for it, in my opinion.
i entered my gmail address and password correctly BUT still denied access that either email or password is entered incorrectly
It never opens your email but keeping complaining about the wrong input.
I like it, its very simple, fast and it has it all, except one thing.. Unified Inbox. Id like to see it in the future.

Geary is a lightweight yet feature rich mail client. It supports outlook aliases feature which is great. It's sad that the devs abandoned the PPA it used to maintain and moved to flathub leaving us Ubuntu users either install another whole separate packaging system (which creates confusion among new users who gets confused while browsing store) or use an increasingly old version. :-(
can not access my gmail account
Note: You have to just add your gmail in online account and it will automatically pick your gmail
summary: Works perfectly on gnome using ubuntu 20.04

description: Thunderbird and Evolution feel too old, all I want is a slick and streamlined email app. Geary is just what I want. Getting the accounts to sync, as they were initially set up for Evolution through GNOME's default integration, they had to be reset and reconnected. The in-app dialogues for "retrying" connection with the accounts didn't do anything, the tokens needed to be regenerated in Settings > Accounts closing and renewing the accounts from inside Geary. Fully worth it.
Automatically blocked by Google and can't proceed
I love that it works with the built-in accounts for Ubuntu. I add all my accounts there and it automatically pulls in all my emails.

3.36 finally connects to my mail server, so there's progress there. Reading, composing and send e-mails works as well. I think that's worth 3 stars. 

Beyond that, many essential features are still lacking. (Some, like a setting signature are possible the .ini file, but not the UI.)

There is always something that stops working. Especially after suspending my computer.

Either I do not get notified about new Emails, or it does not sync with the imap server but sending emails works, or it looses the connection to the email server.
Also I cannot search through all of my emails, just the ones that were downloaded to my computer.

All in all it's an unreliable email client.
summary: Looks lean and does its job for a while but..

description:
I appreciate Geary's simplicity. Gnome already has calendar and contacts. I only want a simple program to check my email. Geary fulfills that role perfectly. It also blends in with the rest of Gnome.

I appreciate that it pulls from account info I've already linked to in Fedora.

One feature that is missing is an integrated inbox. I use two email accounts. It would be nice to check a single inbox.

The second thing is that even though I appreciate it links to any accounts I've set up, it really needs the option to ignore them. For instance, I linked Fedora to my MS account. But I don't acually have an email account associated to that account. Geary keeps checking and reporting an error. A simple 'don't check for email here' would get rid of that.
summary: Good and simple. Maybe too simple?

description: i like the design. very simple.
summary: a classic client. very nice. simple

description: The mail list text doesn't seem to be affected by the system font size. It's absolutely tiny. The button icons are also inconsistent while using Yaru. Some buttons seem to use hardcoded Geary icons while others are from the Yaru theme.

Geary is a mail client, which contains all basic features for mail messaging and integrates well into the Gnome environment.
It is missing more advanced features such like GPG encryption.
Has a clean interface, is snappy and easy to use. I recommend it to anyone looking for a good looking and easy to use e-mail app.
Let's me work with my office emails seamlessly and also supports the notification shade.
Mulitple occasions when cpu usage was 100% while geary was running in background on Gnome.
I really like it. It's easy to use. Design is simple and pretty. Easy to connect Gmail, Outlook, IMAP accounts.

That issues was on the part of Google though. Geary for me blows Thunderbird out of the water! Thunderbird is so cluttered and old looking that I really believe Purism needs to make Geary the default email client in Pure OS.
NO MATTER WHAT YOU WILL DO IT'LL ALWAYS SAY - USERNAME OR PASSWORD INCORRECT !! GUYS, BETTER TO SHUT THIS APPLICATION DOWN OR WORK ON IT.
best personal email client for gnome

I really like the modern interface that Geary provides. Using a conversational view of messages is really handy for keeping track of them. And the simplicity of the app is really great! Give it a try!
summary: I think this app is underrated

description: Very good to use with GNOME desktop. Accounts are automatically added through GNOME.
Working flawlessly and powerfull.. Love it

Geary is one of the few email clients on Linux that "just works" with no config. Contrary to many reviews here (some of which are 4+ years old), Geary isn't unmaintained. In fact it is under active development.
summary: Works with no fuss; UI doesn't get in the way

description: Constant errors and it didn't even work on the first installation.

Most email clients, and we do not have a lot of choices, fells like a 90's email client. I ditched thunderbird long ago. same for evolution. This client is slick and integrates with the desktop like a charm. If some accounts "fail" is not because of the client itself blame google or Microsoft. Even if you log with the online accounts option, you might get errors. But if you configure outlook as IMAP you won't get any issue. Gmail... well, apparently, not even two factor authentication will help because they sell it as part of their suite. therefore, pay them or it will only work on android or using the browser. This client can deal with every IMAP/POP3 account that I've been using, notifies even closed.

keep it up. This is the email client that an awesome desktop needs. Simple, slick, and with delightful details.
summary: The best of the best. And overall, it fits with this century

description: Geary is very simple to use and has a very clean interface.
super app
summary: You should definitley try this app

description: Clean slick and the outdated reviews are wrong. Is updated. works great and haves gnome integration. It can also notify on the background. The best email app for the gnome desktop.
The crashes and the slow email checking rate give it this rating other than that its ok
summary: The crashes and the slow email checking rate

description: Disconnects with «working offline» all the time, and the application needs to be killed and restarted to get it working again.
Still buggy. Needs to be stable.
summary: Still buggy. Needs to be stable

description: People have come to expect more from email clients. When you actually get more features from the web based tools I find it difficult to argue for this one. One example: you may want to have spelling and grammar in 2 languages. On Gmail and Outlook, the language is auto detected and suggestions are provided. This is just one expectation today that is not met. It would not be endless hours to use some online api's to detect language and spelling. Why rely on such old dictionaries that need manual care?
Been using it for a little while without any issues
This a cute as it can be email client for kids and know nothings, useless as a business client.

The email panel keeps turning empty. At first I thought it was when I alt-tabbed (for privacy reasons) but later it emptied in the middle of writing an email. It's very inconvenient because I have to go to Drafts and wait for it to fetch my draft from the server before it's even displayed.

Also, I turned on automatic background email checking, but still, when I pulled Geary up, I saw 2 new emails, and when I switched to another folder and back to Inbox, a third one from over 6 hours ago popped up. (The other two unread emails were newer!)
bad GUI for an email client
The app keeps closing when I try to open attachments.
It is better than thunderbird. i like its design. though it is still B/W
summary: In ubuntu, this is the best,

description: Very basic, no calendar, BUT it does give you notifications on new e-mails even if it is not open, which is exactly what I wanted. Tried Thunderbird/Evolution (which are great and with calendars) but I could not get any notifications for new mail unless the apps were left open.

Ich nutze Geary unter Fedora 36 seit ca. 2 Jahren. Die App integriert sich super in Gnome 42, nutzt die im System konfigurierten IMAP Server, läuft stabil, bringt unterstützung für Gmail und Outlook mit, kann prima mit (sehr) vielen Mails umgehen und bleibt trotzdem sehr minimalistisch!

Von meiner Seite aus also eine ganz klare Empfehlung!
Ich finde Geary sehr gut und einfach zu bedienen. Doch es ist manchmal der Fall, dass es sich nicht mehr mit dem Server verbinden will. Darum leider nur vier von fünf Sternen.

Installation and setup was fast and easy, but on a 4k monitor the message reading area only goes from top to the middle of the screen, wasting half the vertically available space and leaving you with a giant void in the lower half of the screen. Oh, and a caldav plugin would be great!
summary: Nice, but needs updates for today's monitors

description: Das war mal mein Lieblings-E-Mail Client. Aber leider funktioniert er nicht mehr richtig. Das Programm startet nie richtig, erst beim dritten Versuch werden meine Mails angezeigt. Schade drum...
läuft ohne Ärger Was will man mehr.
Funktioniert ohne Probleme, ist klein und schnell.

Nice look and feel, but not stable. Once my email is not sent, the other time, it eats up all memory.
Evolution doesn't have such a nice UI but is way more stable and reliable.
Meiner Meinung nach der beste Mail client
Ist auch kompatibel zu den Ubuntu Online Konten.
Der beste Mail client

Ich dachte ich probiere nach 20 Jahren Thunderbird mal was modernes aus. Aber Geary ist es leider nicht, die einfachheit gefällt mir noch aber das ich die mails nicht einfach als spam markieren kann...vileicht hab ich es auch einfach nicht verstanden aber ich bleib lieber beim guten alten Thunder, da funktioniert alles easy.

...aus meiner Sicht hat die App noch einen weiten Weg vor sich. Zwar mag ich die simple, übersichtliche und leicht zu bedienende Oberfläche, doch es mangelt unter der schönen Oberfläche klar an Funktion. Sortier- oder Filtermöglichkeiten fehlen, ebenso eine Anpassungsmöglichkeit für den viel zu kleinen Text. Der Indikator für neue Nachrichten neben den Ordnern aktualisiert sich nicht immer korrekt. Potenzial ist vorhanden, ich bleibe aber bei Thunderbird.
Das ist ein schlichtes gut funktionierendes Programm . Dreimal Daumen hoch :-)
Ein Email Cient ohne Adressbuch? Absolut unbenutzbar. Schade, weiles gut aussieht. Und keine deutsche Lokalisierug. Eine weitere Enttuschung.

Ich hatte grosse Hoffnung auf Geary, auch weil Aral es empfohlen hatte. Leider war es für meine tägliche Benutzung ungeeignet. Die UI ist recht gewöhnungsbedürftig, besonders weil: * keine Ordnerhierarchie, alles wird flach dargestellt; * einzelne Emails zu löschen geht schwer, stattdessen soll ich den ganzen Thread löschen, * jede Interaktion erzeugt ein Benachtrichtigungsfenster, das natürlich genau über den Buttons liegt, die man danach anklicken will, ...
summary: Schlechte UI, keine Unterstützung für offline Imap, ..

description: Ich benutze GEARY mit Ubuntu Budgie Focal und habe bislang keinen Fehler feststellen können. Startet schnell und funktioniert einfach nur. Kein kompliziertes einrichten, über Systemeinstellungen einen Online Account wie GMAIL hinzufügen und er ist in GEARY drinn...

Ich hab in etwa 4000 Mails in mienem Postfach, jedes mal wenn neue abgeholt werden bleibt das Programm für mehrere Minuten hängen und die Festplatte ist dabei extrem aktiv.
Es würde mich nicht stören wenn die UI in dieser Phase bedienbar bleibt, ist sie aber nicht. Nutze jetzt evolution als Mailclient, der ist zwar etwas altbacken, hat aber keine Performanceprobleme
summary: Sehr zäh bei vielen Mails und normaler HDD

description: Super Mail Programm mit voller Gnome Optik!

Kam auf GEARY nachdem ich mit Ubuntu arbeite.
Es ist einfach , schnell und funktioniert selbsterklärend.
??.
summary: Ich benutze GEARY seit einem Jahr

description: Schlankes, angenehm einfaches und übersichtliches E-Mail-Programm, das mich vom Aufbau der Benutzeroberfläche her an die Mail-App von Apple erinnert. Unter Ubuntu Budgie ist Geary die Standard-E-Mail-App. Ideal zum Lesen meiner Gmail-Nachrichten. Bei der Beantwortung von Nachrichten weist das Programm einige kleinere Fehler in der deutschen Lokalisierung auf (u. a. bei der Datums- und Zeitangabe). Eine Funktion zur Einstellung einer Signatur ist bei Geary auch vorhanden, aber ziemlich gut versteckt. Um sie zu finden, muss man oben in der Bedienleiste auf das Hamburger-Menü bzw. auf das Symbol mit den drei Punkten klicken, den Menüpunkt Konten auswählen und dann das jeweilige E-Mail-Konto anklicken. Daraufhin öffnet sich ein Fenster, in dem man dann nach unten scrollt und die gewünschte Signatur in das entsprechende Eingabefeld einfügt.
naja wdasd qwqw d qwd
intuitive Oberfläche die sich ausgezeichnet in Gnome einfügt.
Wählt mann die yahoo oder drunter an geht geary aus

Braucht sehr lange zum starten. Emailadressen lassan sich nicht einrichten.
Open Suse Tumblewwed.
Keine Abstürze, Tastaturbedienung ok. Alles super!
Keep it simple. Super!
It does everything you want to. You can easily manage multiple Email Accounts with it. I am removing it now because it is just a little bit too simple and sometimes slow for me.
summary: Good with clean Interface, but I prefer having more Options

description: Bei mir funktioniert das Mailprogramm super. Optische Darstellung perfekt. Danke an den Entwickler.
Findet ja noch nicht mal automatisch die Provider Einstellungen. Gmail will er auch nicht.....zurück Thunderbird.

Schönes übersichtliches Programm. Kann ich nur empfehlen.
Mein Verbesserungsvorschlag als Ergänzung währe allerdings, dass es die Möglichkeit gäbe, Mails unterschiedlich farbig zu markieren. Ich nutze unseren Udunturechner mit meinen Kollegen und auch ein gemeinsames Emailpostfach. Bei uns hat dann jeder eine Farbe, mit der er seine Emails markieren kann, damit man mehr eine Übericht hat, wer für welche Mails zuständig ist. Daher nur 4 Sterne. Bei Evulution und auf dem Mailprogramm von Mac geht das. Würde ich mir für Geary auch wünschen.
summary: Tolles Programm, dem Mailprogramm von Mac ähnlich

description: ... holt von 200 Mails im Archiv 21 ab. Dann tut sich nichts mehr. Und befinde ich mich im Order Archiv, wird die Schaltfläche Archivieren angeboten. Sollte doch wenigsten inaktiv sein. Echt schade, die Einfachheit und die klare Oberfläche sprechen mich sonst sehr an. Ich probiere es irgendwann nochmal.
summary: Schade, wäre echt mein Ding gewesen, aber..

description:
Geary überzeugt mich persönlich auf ganzer Linie! Es ist ein sehr minimalistisches Programm, was allerdings gerade in sicherheitskritischen Bereichen, wie es das Arbeiten mit E-Mails nunmal ist, mit wenigen Funktionen auskommt, diese dafür aber effizient implementiert hat.

Zusätzlich integriert sich Geary hervorragend in die Gnome Arbeitsumgebung (hier unter Fedora 36).

Nachdem die E-mail Anbieter in den Gnome Systemeinstellungen unter Online-Konten angelegt sind, macht Geary daraus genau das was es soll.

Wer mit dem Funktionsumfang nicht auskommt und mehr braucht, dem möchte ich Evolution ans Herz legen.

Unterm Strich ein wirklich tolles Stück freie Software.
Schlicht, einfach, klein und funktionell. Alles was man braucht und nicht mehr.
leichte einstellung,einfach super
summary: einfach super ohne ärger besser als thunderbird

description: Authentification does not work.
Viele Abstürze bei Suchanfragen! Anhang Bearbeitung ohne Drag and Drop usw...
summary: Anfang als gut empfunden, der Fehler liegt im Detail

description: Sehr übersichtlich und funktional gehalten.
Der Beste E-Mail client
There are fundamental issues with some basic features, for example the search is not working correctly. So I need to move to Thunderbird again...
Installiert, starten, öffnet nicht

Ich komme frisch von Windows und empfinde geary als sehr guten Ersatz für Windows Mail. Ein Filter für ungelesene Mails fände ich noch gut. Falls so etwas schon existiert habe ich diese Option bisher noch nicht finden können.
seit ich den Gnome Desktop benutze ist Geary mein EMail Client

The first mails were normally received but then it suddenly stopped working without ever giving any errors. Nearly cost me my university studies and my sanity, because it looked like I just didn't get any Emails.

I rather just use the website.
No funciona con Yahoo... no le da la gana iniciar sesión. Pues vale... Una pérdida de tiempo.
, minimalista, sencilla, cumple su objetivo, lo unico que no logre hacer fue marcar un mensaje como que no era spam en la carpeta spam y no puedo crear reglas.
summary: Me parece una buena aplicacion de correo

description: Los felicito, sigan trabajando para hacer de este cliente de correo, el mejor
me gusta mucho, es un buen gestor de correos.
En mi caso se crashea muy seguido,lo tengo configurado con dos cuentas IMAP y es común que falle y termine cerrandose. Tiene un aspecto muy minimalista y cumple su fucnión.
Sirvió perfecto para mi hotmail :3

La aplicación esta de lujo y hay algo con lo que batallo día a día tener que revisar entre correos ya leídos y buscar algunos de unos días atrás pendientes es complicado; con eso creo que sería sensacional!
Siempre se cuelga la aplicación al abrir mis dos cuentas de correo, la personal de Gmail y una IMAP del trabajo, tengo que forzar el cierre cerca de tres veces para que pueda cargar mis cuentas.
Me gustaría que solo contara los correos no leídos y que los resalte de mejor manera para poder administrar todo mucho más fácil.
no me dejo registrar  contraseña incorrecta
La he instalado y no me detecta mi cuenta de correo

Me gusta su diseño minimalista y sencillo (típico de GNOME), aunque echo en falta opciones como un botón de recarga por si quiero manualmente revisar si hay nuevo correo. 
Además, a veces dice que ha entrado en "Modo desconectado" y no me deja enviar correos, incluso si mi conexión de WiFi está al maximo.
Por el momento usaré Evolution, a ver si a la próxima version le doy una oportunidad.
Funciona a la perfección, es liviano y rapido.
Con Gmail no funciona.
Me encanta, pero no he podido gestionar con Gmail. Una pena.
summary: Una interface sencilla que me encanta pero dificultades con Gmail

description: Es a mi criterio mejor que thunderbird. No será tan "robusto" pero es un cliente ligero y trabaja perfecto con cuentas IMAP y POP de todo tipo. Eso incluye outlook gmail e incluso Icloud. Además, tiene mejor integración con gnome, notifica incluso cerrado y arrancándolo al inicio va de mil maravillas.
Es muy rapido y productivo
Es rapido y no me ha dado errores
muy buena las aplicaciones de gnome como integra con las cuenta de correo como los organiza literalmente supremo y tambien este gran gestor de correo

Me gusta mucho, pero le falta una cosa para ser definitivo y es que no tiene filtros leído/no leído o por remitente, así como agrupar bandejas de entrada de varias cuentas. Con esto sería el cliente definitivo para mí.
Estéticamente es precioso, muy parecido al gestor de correo de Mac. Es rápido, bonito y funciona bien.
summary: Como el gestor de Correo de Apple

description: Buena integración con el escritorio Gnome. Cliente rápido y ligero.

No es un buen gestor de correos. Desde que lo instalé empecé a recibir una cantidad enorme de correo basura. Además para eliminar un correo hay que abrirlo, no se puede eliminar sin abrir. 
Es un pésimo gestor, no lo bajen puede ser peligroso o tener programas espías.
summary: Desde que lo instalé empecé a recibir correo basura

description: La uso en mi día a día, me gustaría que tuviese más opciones de personalización. Muy buen trabajo, gracias.
Está muy bien la aplicación, es ligera y se integra bien en gnome 40. Se echa de menos mas personalizaciones, aplicación de extensiones etc. No me ha dejado configurar yahoo .
para mi funciona perfecto es simple pero bien hecha
es un gran gestor de email, carga todo perfecto tanto texto como imagenes, notificiaciones y demas. gran grabajo
Cumple con lo que promete de una froma facil y rapida
Es simple pero muy funcional y bonito.
summary: El mejor cliente de correo en GNU Linux

description: Muy bonito, mucha promesa,... pero lentísimo y difícil de gestionar debido a que casi todos lo asumen

Está muy bien para mandar un correo al día pero para uso intensivo no cumple.
- ¡No se puede redimensionar el panel de lectura!
- Obviamente no se puede redimensionar ni el panel de mensajes ni la vista de arbol.
- Es imposible ocultar las conversaciones, por lo que si tienes una conversación con 100 respuestas te tendrás que pasar una hora haciendo scroll por los encabezados de todos los mensajes...
- No tiene un mísero filtro de correos no leídos, por lo que buena suerte buscando en una conversación grande a ver qué mensaje te queda por leer.
- ¡No tiene un boton de refrescar o enviar o recibir! Asi que hasta que al programa no le de la gana refrescar la lista de correos no podras ver ninguno.
- La lista puede seguir pero si arreglaran esto al menos ya sería usable...
este cliente de correo es de los buenos

Me gusta mas que Evolution, pero por favor, agreguen alguna opcion donde se ven los mails que te permita filtrar por leido/no leido al igual que permita agrupar por fechas o mas recientes/menos recientes. El resto genial!
Sin embargo, si la usas con yahoo, falla, com outlook falla, con mi servidor imap falla, solo funciona bien con gmail :(
summary: Me encanta la interfaz, creo que es la mejor

description:
Me gustaría:

1) poder pasar de un correo abierto al siguiente o anterior sin tener que volver para atrás

2) estando en la lista de correos, poder clickear en alguna parte para seleccionarlo sin abrirlo.

siento que se pierde mucho tiempo en volver para atrás sin estas características.
summary: Me gusta el salto a libadwaita, pero le faltan algunas opciones

description:
Fréquence de mise à jour des boîtes email incompréhensible: par exemple, j'ai 2 boîtes gmail, une est rafraîchie instantanément, et l'autre non
Le lendemain, le comportement est tout autre
Le bouton pour forcer le rafraîchissement manque vraiment ou alors il faudrait que cela fonctionne bien mieux
est incapable d'enregistrer le mot de passe
It does what we expect from a simple mail client. In particular the UI is close to Mail on Mac OS X.
summary: Simple, do the job and do it well

description: Ne manque plus qu'une meilleure gestion des contacts.
Voila une application adaptée à ce que l'on en fait. GNOME devrait juste abandonner Evolution et forker Geary comme elementary OS.
J'aimerais que l'on puisse choisir si on veut ou non le tri par conversations.
L'ergonomie est assez sympa, mais l'application cruellement de certaines fonctionnalités.

Pour moi, bien meilleure ergonomie que Thunderbird bien que moins complet. Mode conversation impec (si on aime). Par contre pas d'intégration du carnet d'adresse et ça s'est rédhibitoire pour un logiciel de mail. Dommage mais j'attends les évolutions avec impatience.
J'ai essayé avec mes mails personnels mais impossible de s'y connecter :-/
Impossible de se connecter §

Geary est un client courriel simple et ergonomique pour un usage basique, mais il souffre de certains défauts. Il s'intègre au carnet d'adresse de Gnome (Gnome Contacts), à qui il délègue la gestion des correspondants (sans possibilité d'édition ou d'ajout de contact).
Trop pensé pour s'intégrer à Gmail (les dossiers sont traités comme des libellés, c'est très bien pour les utilisateurs de Gmail, mais c'est problématique pour tous les autres), il présente encore quelques bugs, que chaque nouvelle version tend à corriger (actuellement, il n'enregistre pas les messages envoyés dans le dossier « SENT », mais dans un dossier « Envoyés » créé par lui-même, contrairement au comportement par défaut de l'ensemble des autres clients mail existants).
Il ne propose bien évidemment aucune fonctionnalité avancée (chiffrement/signature des messages, filtres ou client managesieve, etc.), ni possibilité de rechercher ou trier finement les messages.
Très belle application, conviviale, mais aucune gestion des contacts digne de ce nom : pas d'envoi groupé possible.

Bonne application mail, jolie, simple, efficace... Peut être un petit peu trop, c'est ce qui me retient à vrai dire, je m'en sort mieux avec le bon vieux thunderbird.
Manque pour moi :
- Un tri/filtre plus efficace
- Un carnet d'adresse synchro Cardav 
- Cerise sur le gâteau, qui me ferait basculer sur Geary : Un agenda Caldav

je n'arrive pas a ajouter mon compte gmail
Benoît DENECKER
C'est le meilleur client mail que j'ai vu ! Simple et efficace que demander de plus ?
Je n'arrive pas a me connecter a mon compte gmail

Application très complète, à l'interface simpliste, et facile à utiliser. Traductions réussies, en tout cas pour le français.

Je recommande.
summary: Un client email génial, je vous le recommande

description: Pas aussi complet qu'on Évolution ou Thunderbird mais tellement plus léger et convivial !

Interface mieux conçu que evolution ( surchargé ). 
Fait ce qu'on attend d'un logiciel de mail
S’intègre bien avec GNOME
très bonne application (simple, fluide, ....)
Et aucune option, très très basique en somme, Evolution est meilleur
summary: Impossible d'afficer les images par défaut

description: Impossible de se conncter.
impossible de se connecter aux reseaux

Léger, user-friendly et contient toute les fonctionnalités nécessaires. Gmail y marche parfaitement.
Je recommande !
bien moins ergonomique que thunderbird.
Impossible de désactiver le tri par conversations. Malheureusement, pour moi c'est rédhibitoire.

Je n'attendais qu'une seule chose de cette application et elle le fait très bien. L'interface est très belle et intuitive et l'intégration avec Gnome est quasiment parfaite, il ne manque que la compatibilité avec libadvaita et gtk4 pour que ce soit 5 étoiles !
Пишет, что не существует такая почта, хотя с других приложений в нее спокойно заходит

Когда люди прекратят искать thunderbird там, где его нет, наверняка отзывы заметно улучшатся. Простая, минималистичная даже и интуитивно понятная, что всем от неё ещё нужно я не понимаю. Подтягивает почты привязанные к гному, в общем, достойная вещь
Всё нравится, постабильнее бы ещё чуть-чуть
Вместо него рекомендую Evolution, там не было таких проблем со входом.
summary: С моей почтой gmail не заработало

description: Легкий почтовый клиент без огромной кучи настроек, только необходимый минимум. Но в Ubuntu 18.04 у меня проблема - после сна постоянно вылетают ошибки авторизации в почтовых сервисах. И так после нескольких таких ошибок клиент просто зависает, а после перезапуска перестаёт принимать и отправлять почту. А также есть проблема с кодировкой имени отправителя, вместо нормального текста какие-то крякозябры пишет.
2019, it's still using dead single codepages, like ASCII, KOI8 etc and doesn't know what is UTF-8.
работает только учетка от gmail. yahoo.com предустановлены настройки. работает только забор почты. отправка не работает. изменить настройки не возможно. mail.ru - вообще не работает.
Не заработал с GMail
До Thunderbird, как до Китая ползком. Поиск работает непонятно как, настроек никаких вообще. По функциональности переиграть, наверное, может только WEB-клиент того же Gmail, и то не факт.
Нельзя прописать корпоративную почту!
I was want use it because it have notification on desktop, but I can't use it with Gmail (
summary: Two-factor authorization does not work for Gmail

description: При запуске окно программы уехало за все возможные границы монитора. Создание аккаунта в gmail закончилось ничем. Возможно нужны танцы с бубном, но заниматься этим совершенно нет желания.
20.04 не запускается...((

Это почтовая программа! А не программа для заметок или планировщика задач. В этом ее приемущество. Все нужное именно для почты тут есть. Неплохо бы еще интерфейс покросивее сделать (см. как в Elementary OS эту программу вылизали).
Все нравится. Спасибо!

В Ubuntu 20.04 исправили большинство проблем с почтовым клиентом. Работать стало намного лучше. Но не понятно откуда потребление в 500 МБ оперативной памяти при закрытом клиенте мне не понятно. При этом функционал у этого почтового клиента минимальный.
summary: Выглядит очень простым, но потребляет много

description: Самый приятный и удобный интерфейс клиента из всех существующих. Спасибо разработчикам! Так держать!
дружелюбный интерфейс. Для бытовых задач подходит очень хорошо
На сервере почта есть, а программа ее не забирает.
нет фильтров и автоматического распределения по папкам
summary: нет фильтров и автоматического распределения по папкам

description: Просто и понятно, глюков нет.
При попытке подключения к gmail почте ругается на неверный логин или пароль. Доступ для небезопасных приложений в аккаунте разрешен.
Удобно, шустро, красиво, но функционала хотелось бы чуть больше.
Приятный и красивый интерфейс, но о том, что надо разрешить доступ небезопасным приложениям в гугл аккаунте могли бы и предупредить.
Интерфейс хороший, но то, что для всех отправителей нужно вручную включать показ изображений выбешивает. Лучше уж буду использовать через браузер
Пишет не верное имя и пароль. Вручную тоже ни в какую не хочет. Debian 10.10.

Хороший почтовик, немного криво работает при более одном почтовым ящике и о необходимости разрешить вход для не безопасных приложений в гугл аккаунте могли бы и сказать, но в остальном - красивый, легкий и уютный интерфейс.

Нельзя перейти к письмам на 500 сообщений назад и даже меньше. Убрали вид с тремя панелями. Ужас. Как-будто для телефона, а не для ПК. Интерфейс неудобный. Функционал допотопный. Столько времени существует, а лучше не стал.

Использую в данный момент его в качестве основного клиента на учётках gmail (GSuite, корпоративная почта) и yandex. Всё работает. Правда, насколько я понимаю, с "тяжелыми" ящиками (в моём случае под 27 Гб) ему приходится нелегко, поэтому не рекомендую при настройке синхронизировать всю накопившуюся почту за последние несколько лет.

При всём уважении к Thunderbird не очень я сдружился с его дизайном и нахлобученностью. С Evolution уехал из-за их кривого wysiwyg редактора. Mailspring до сих пор то там, то тут сталкивается с разного рода багами,
summary: Как почтовый клиент - хорош, на большее пока не претендует

description: Классная программа, удобный и красивый интерфейс. Но к сожалению проблемы с получением почты. Замечено с несколькими почтовыми сервисами. На сервере почта есть, а в программе их нет. И нет кнопки, чтобы получить почту с сервера.
Не возможно найти файл при сохранении письма в формате .pdf через функцию печати . И С П Р А В Ь Т Е !
summary: Лаконичное приложение, ни чего лишнего. Работает

description: Отличное было приложение, но после последнего обновления текст письма на пол экрана. Зачем урезали окно письма? Всё теперь мелко и нечитаемо. До этого расположение окон было идеально.
Работает без проблем. Нравится. С ранними версиями были проблемы, но теперь все норм.

在Ubuntu中，添加QQ邮箱账号，需要先在设置、在线账户、IMAP和SMTP中添加。否则，Geary问题添加不成功。
另，不知什么原因，TOM、Outlook邮箱可以收到邮件，126和QQ邮箱显示连接成功，但一直显示收件，但没收到。
界面很漂亮，体验很好，但是有严重bug，发送邮件失败，而且邮件会丢失，草稿箱和其他文件夹都找不到
邮件宽度较大时无法横向滑动，查阅不便
还可以。。但是我现在不怎么使用。
可以使用exchange么？？
